alert.note: Alert for Baker; Harney; Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 15 at 11:17AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...SNOWMELT WILL INCREASE THROUGH THE WEEKEND RESULTING IN RISING WATER LEVELS ON CREEKS, STREAMS, AND RIVERS... Melting of the lower and mid elevation snowpack will continue as a warming trend occurs through Sunday. This will increase the risk of flooding along creeks, streams, and rivers through early in the week. The risk of sheet flooding in flat low-lying terrain and poor drainage areas will increase as well. If there is deep snow in your area, clear snow, ice and debris from culverts and other flow paths to allow runoff to flow away from buildings and other vulnerable infrastructure. Move deep snow away from the foundations of buildings and move equipment, and livestock out of poorly drained or low lying areas. Stay tuned to the latest hydrologic forecasts.
